item.title: The Power Of Genes, And The Line Between Biology And Destiny
item.description: May 12, 2017 - Dr. Siddhartha Mukherjee says genetics play a significant role in identity, temperament, sexual orientation and disease risk — but that environment also matters. Originally broadcast May 15, 2016.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 12, 2017 - Dr. Siddhartha Mukherjee says genetics play a significant role in identity, temperament, sexual orientation and disease risk — but that environment also matters. Originally broadcast May 15, 2016. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/12/528097708/the-power-of-genes-and-the-line-between-biology-and-destiny

item.title: Inflatable Beds: Dangerous For Infants, Attractive To Cash-Strapped Parents
item.description: May 12, 2017 - Inflatable beds are increasingly popular, and their soft, impermeable surfaces, increase risk of sudden infant death. But they are often the only bed that a family can afford.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 12, 2017 - Inflatable beds are increasingly popular, and their soft, impermeable surfaces, increase risk of sudden infant death. But they are often the only bed that a family can afford. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/12/527652923/inflatable-beds-dangerous-for-infants-attractive-to-cash-strapped-parents

item.title: Fake Medical News Can Now Be Fact-Checked In India
item.description:
May 12, 2017 - Whatsapp is spreading bogus medical advice in India. A website called Check4Spam is debunking the claims.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/12/526687362/fake-medical-news-can-now-be-fact-checked-in-india
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 12, 2017 - Whatsapp is spreading bogus medical advice in India. A website called Check4Spam is debunking the claims. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/12/526687362/fake-medical-news-can-now-be-fact-checked-in-india

item.title: Friday News Roundup - Domestic
item.description: May 12, 2017 - The controversial firing of FBI Director James Comey dominated the news this week. Guest host John Donvan and a panel of journalists discuss that and other happenings around the U.S., including the Texas governor's ban on sanctuary cities and how Shaquille O'Neal might do as a sheriff.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 12, 2017 - The controversial firing of FBI Director James Comey dominated the news this week. Guest host John Donvan and a panel of journalists discuss that and other happenings around the U.S., including the Texas governor's ban on sanctuary cities and how Shaquille O'Neal might do as a sheriff. http://the1a.org/shows/2017-05-12/friday-news-roundup-domestic

item.title: Sue Klebold: When Your Son Does The Unthinkable, Can You Forgive Him And Yourself?
item.description: May 12, 2017 - Sue Klebold's son Dylan was one of the two shooters at Columbine High School. Nearly 20 years later, she talks about her struggle to understand his actions, and to find forgiveness.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 12, 2017 - Sue Klebold's son Dylan was one of the two shooters at Columbine High School. Nearly 20 years later, she talks about her struggle to understand his actions, and to find forgiveness. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/12/527939178/sue-klebold-when-your-son-does-the-unthinkable-can-you-forgive-him-and-yourself

item.title: Focus On Infants During Childbirth Leaves U.S. Moms In Danger
item.description: May 12, 2017 - The U.S. has the worst rate of maternal deaths in the developed world: Sixty percent of the 700 to 900 deaths each year are preventable, including that of neonatal nurse Lauren Bloomstein.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 12, 2017 - The U.S. has the worst rate of maternal deaths in the developed world: Sixty percent of the 700 to 900 deaths each year are preventable, including that of neonatal nurse Lauren Bloomstein. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/12/527806002/focus-on-infants-during-childbirth-leaves-u-s-moms-in-danger

item.title: Communities Key To Fighting Opioid Crisis, HHS Secretary Says
item.description: May 12, 2017 - Health and Human Services Secretary Tom Price is touring communities that have been hit hard by painkiller overdoses and heroin. He says, when it comes to opioid abuse, "We're losing as a nation."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 12, 2017 - Health and Human Services Secretary Tom Price is touring communities that have been hit hard by painkiller overdoses and heroin. He says, when it comes to opioid abuse, "We're losing as a nation." http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/12/527936103/communities-key-to-fighting-opioid-crisis-hhs-secretary-says

item.title: Heroin Epidemic Is Driving A Spike In Hepatitis C Cases, CDC Says
item.description: May 11, 2017 - From 2010 to 2015, the number of new infections leaped nearly 300 percent, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. And researchers appear confident of the cause.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 11, 2017 - From 2010 to 2015, the number of new infections leaped nearly 300 percent, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. And researchers appear confident of the cause. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/11/528004120/heroin-epidemic-is-driving-a-spike-in-hepatitis-c-cases-cdc-says

item.title: Superbugs 'Crawled Out' Of The Ocean 450 Million Years Ago
item.description: May 11, 2017 - We think of antibiotic-resistance as a modern-day problem. Now scientists have evidence that these superbugs have been around for eons. Clues to their origin are offering clues to their defeat.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 11, 2017 - We think of antibiotic-resistance as a modern-day problem. Now scientists have evidence that these superbugs have been around for eons. Clues to their origin are offering clues to their defeat. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/11/527792274/superbugs-crawled-out-of-the-ocean-450-million-years-ago

item.title: Trump's Proposed USAID Head Knows Aid — And Politics
item.description: May 11, 2017 - Mark Green is a former congressman, ambassador — and teacher of English in Kenya. What are aid groups saying about his nomination?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 11, 2017 - Mark Green is a former congressman, ambassador — and teacher of English in Kenya. What are aid groups saying about his nomination? http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/11/527995708/trumps-proposed-usaid-head-knows-aid-and-politics

item.title: With Alcoholism Rampant On Nearby Reservation, Nebraska Shuts Town's Liquor Stores
item.description: May 11, 2017 - The state shuttered stores in Whiteclay, Neb., which borders the dry Pine Ridge reservation, where half the adults struggle with alcohol abuse. But critics say the move infringes upon business rights.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 11, 2017 - The state shuttered stores in Whiteclay, Neb., which borders the dry Pine Ridge reservation, where half the adults struggle with alcohol abuse. But critics say the move infringes upon business rights. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/05/11/527832897/with-alcoholism-rampant-on-nearby-reservation-nebraska-shuts-towns-liquor-stores

item.title: Is Rape A Pre-Existing Condition? Not Exactly
item.description: May 11, 2017 - Before the Affordable Care Act, rape victims could have been denied coverage for conditions tied to their assault. Some worry those practices could return if the current GOP health bill becomes law.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 11, 2017 - Before the Affordable Care Act, rape victims could have been denied coverage for conditions tied to their assault. Some worry those practices could return if the current GOP health bill becomes law. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/11/527938951/is-rape-a-pre-existing-condition-not-exactly

item.title: Why Your Sense Of Smell Is Better Than You Might Think
item.description: May 11, 2017 - A neuroscientist argues that our noses are more powerful than we think. Humans, he says, actually have a great sense of smell.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 11, 2017 - A neuroscientist argues that our noses are more powerful than we think. Humans, he says, actually have a great sense of smell. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/11/527750147/why-your-sense-of-smell-is-better-than-you-might-think

item.title: Cholera 101: An Ancient Disease Keeps Cropping Up
item.description: May 11, 2017 - The latest cholera surge is in Yemen, and Haiti is still fighting the world's worst outbreak. Why does this waterborne disease remain a global health risk?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 11, 2017 - The latest cholera surge is in Yemen, and Haiti is still fighting the world's worst outbreak. Why does this waterborne disease remain a global health risk? http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/11/527586471/cholera-101-an-ancient-disease-keeps-cropping-up

item.title: Arthroscopic Surgery Doesn't Help With Arthritis Knee Pain
item.description: May 11, 2017 - This is the latest study to find that arthroscopic surgery doesn't reduce pain for people with knee arthritis, and can cause other problems. The procedure remains popular in the U.S.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 11, 2017 - This is the latest study to find that arthroscopic surgery doesn't reduce pain for people with knee arthritis, and can cause other problems. The procedure remains popular in the U.S. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/11/527915056/arthroscopic-surgery-doesnt-help-with-arthritis-knee-pain
